title: Time for A Time-Out
description: The feeling of Anger often causes us to act and speak before we think. A very useful tool is to short circuit this natural inclination by giving yourself a 10 count before you act or speak. Read this short WebMD article to find out more about this technique and it's effects.

title: Run or Lift It Out
description: Outbursts of Anger in our culture are often looked down upon and quite honestly are more often than not, inappropriate. It also isn't a good idea to hold anger in as it will eventually become toxic to yourself. Use this quick workout before you walk into a situation you know will make you angry or to help push out some of that angry energy.

title: Clear Your Mind
description: Taking a couple minutes to calm your mind and your body after an anger inducing situation is a great way to prevent that anger from spilling over into the rest of your day. Use this 10 minute guided meditation during your lunch to help calm yourself down see the issue with a new perspective.
